overview: This script initializes interactive behaviors for a healthcare website, including theme toggling, back-to-top visibility, navbar highlighting, skip-to-content accessibility, toast notifications, and contact form validation. It also logs analytics events and respects user motion preferences.
interactions: Click theme toggle to switch between light and dark themes
Scroll to reveal or hide back-to-top button
Click back-to-top to scroll smoothly to top
Navbar links highlight based on current route
Click skip-to-content to focus main content
Show and dismiss toast notifications automatically or on click
routes: Dynamic detection via window.location.pathname for navbar highlighting
No explicit route navigation; relies on anchor hrefs
data_flow: Theme preference stored and retrieved from localStorage
Scroll position triggers UI visibility changes
Toast messages dynamically created and dismissed
Form data expected to be validated before submission
accessibility: Aria attributes for visibility and live regions on toast
Skip-to-content link focuses main content with tabindex
analytics: window.analyticsLog array stores all events with timestamps
test_ideas: Verify theme toggle updates DOM attribute and localStorage
Ensure back-to-top button visibility toggles after scrolling past threshold
Confirm smooth scroll behavior respects reduced motion setting
Validate navbar highlights correct link based on pathname
Check skip-to-content focuses main content and scrolls correctly
Assert toast creation, visibility, and dismissal timing
Confirm analytics events are logged with correct payloads
Test accessibility attributes update correctly during interactions
